items.question: Why does Stripe Meter take 6 months to build?
items.answer: Stripe Meter seems simple: send events, aggregate usage, bill customers. But the edge cases are massive: event validation, idempotency, backfilling historical data, handling retroactive changes, proration on mid-cycle plan changes, debugging discrepancies, and customer support. Ai.Rio has already solved these problems.

items.question: What can I meter with Stripe Meter?
items.answer: Anything you can quantify: API calls, token usage, storage, compute time, transactions, users, seats, messages, searches, etc. The limitation is your imagination.

items.question: How do you handle proration and plan changes?
items.answer: The implementation handles mid-cycle upgrades/downgrades, calculating prorated charges based on usage at the time of change. This is where most homegrown implementations break.

items.question: Do I need to change my entire pricing model?
items.answer: No. Many companies launch usage-based pricing alongside existing plans. You can offer hybrid pricing (base subscription + usage overages) or pure usage pricing. We design the model that fits your market.

items.question: What if I already have events tracked?
items.answer: Even better. We can backfill historical usage data into Stripe Meter and launch with immediate visibility. Existing event infrastructure reduces implementation time.

items.question: How do customers see their usage?
items.answer: The usage dashboard shows current usage, projected billing, usage trends, and alerts when approaching limits. Customers can also see usage breakdowns in their invoices.
